Articles.Content:
hi guys, me and my son found kerbal and downloaded it and so far we are having fun using it (just messing round seeing who can get the highest altitude)

i myself am getting my head around how it works. i can only do a basic rocket and would like to get better.

if you have any advice im all ears

regards

jason

Hello before the pub.

Advice;

1. Getting to space is easy - 69km+.

2. Getting into orbit so you stay in space is harder - read tutorials.

3. Start with small vehicles and simple missions.

4. Sandbox or science mode is much better for learning.

5. See my signature for ship designs.

Welcome aboard!

The strongest advice I can give you would be to look at the Gameplay Questions and Tutorials subforum. You can ask any sort of gameplay question there and it will be answered lickety-split by our armada of technician monkeys.

Furthermore, the Tutorials sub-subforum should be able to answer most basic questions regardless.

Happy flying!
Seems like I was beaten to the punch. I would also suggest the two sections above. Also, check out the Spacecraft Exchange for new ideas.
